Description.Name: Transponder Key
Description.Details:
Darius calls you to the bridge, where you find him fiddling with a small electronic box. "This is what we were looking for, Boss. What we have here is an old ComStar Transponder, something that is nearly impossible to obtain nowadays."

Yang raises his hand. "I think we will need to equip a 'Mech with it and then strap that 'Mech on to the hull of the Argo. Keep it off our ship itself, if we don't we will be attracting ROMS from two jumps away. We can sweep in grab the Mechwarriors and leave." 

Sumire rubs her temples. "I disagree with Yang. We're going to have to change our ship's IFF completely... I mean, if I am reading this correctly. In 30 days there will be an opening for ComStar vessels to slip through and investigate Necromo's primary base. With this on we can get to the planet just in time for the show. We can blow this abomination off the face of the universe once and for all; And not risk further Infection."

Description.Name: Prioritize following up on Yangs' Idea.
High spirits, defend your decision.
Description.Details:
You nod at Yang. "I agree, equipping a 'Mech will make for a far less enticing target for ROM agents from ComStar."

Later, Farah calls you into Engineering. You find her standing in front of a terminal, a huge smile on her face. "I have managed to penetrate the fortress around Necromos—you know, this is some dangerous territory,— but I've done it! Seems Fortresses are generating HPG pulses that throw off navigation computers. The trick is to manually calculate the Jump."

You nod. "Good work, Farah. We will get Darius' men back, thanks to you."

Description.Name: Prioritize following up on Sumire's Idea.
High spirits, the fans approve
Description.Details:
You nod at Sumire. "Okay, Meyer your idea sounds promising. Follow up on it. For the time being, this is your top priority."

Later, she calls you to the bridge. You find her standing by the viewscreen, a weary half-smile on her face. "We got it. Commander, we can slip right in now—ship and all. Seems ComStar has nav computers automatically failing jumps to Necromos, it's kind of a Fortress system. I've got Necromos back on the star map. We can get going whenever you want. "

You nod. "Good work, Sumire. Our rescue plan is back on, thanks to you."

She looks stern. "Don't remind me."
